Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 02:53PM Jenn_1 wrote: Today I went to my local very rural hospital to gather all mammo, ultrasound reports. Through six yrs I seem to have solid modules growing near chest wall. Unasperated, aspired modules that were blood tinged and discarded and dilated breast ducts. Hmmm. Five yrs ago bi-rads3? This place is known as a band aid hospital. Hoping Thursday to get info from the breast specialist. Should blood tinged fluid ever be discarded after breast aspiration? I don't think so. Best for last, said I should be watched at age 49 for breast carcinoma!
